discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Intel CPUs
 VT-x = improving support for virtualization
 Multi-level cache = fastest access to frequently used data
 RISC = improve speed by utilizing relatively few simple instructions.

AMD CPUs
 AMD-V = improving support for virtualization
 Multi-level cache = fastest access to frequently used data
 RISC = improve speed by utilizing relatively few simple instructions.

x86 virtualization is the use of hardware-assisted virtualization capabilities on an x86/x86-64 CPU.

In the late 1990s x86 virtualization was achieved by complex software techniques, necessary to compensate for the processor's lack of hardware-assisted virtualization capabilities while attaining reasonable performance. In 2005 and 2006, both Intel (VT-x) and AMD (AMD-V) introduced limited hardware virtualization support that allowed simpler virtualization software but offered very few speed benefits. Greater hardware support, which allowed substantial speed improvements, came with later processor models.

questions.question_text: A network administrator is deploying virtualization software to several desktop computers. Some of the installations fail because a processor function is disabled in the computer's BIOS. Which of the following functions should be turned on for the installation to succeed?

A user experiences a paper jam when printing a 500-page, double-sided report. A technician clears the paper jam and inspects the printer for any remaining paper. The technician then powers the printer off and back on. The printer's LCD display says it is ready, and all cables are securely connected. The user attempts to print the report again, but the printer still does not print. It also shows no indication of any change. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should the technician attempt FIRST?

discussion.content: If there is a paper jam without anything physical actually causing it, it is most likely the print spooler.

Question asks which should be done FIRST. The printer was just working but now the print jobs are not being successfully sent to the printer. The print spooler is responsible for queuing documents for retrieval by the printer. Documents not being successfully retrieved by the printer would most likely indicate a print spooler error.

choices.A: Replace the drum and toner for the printer.
choices.C: Disassemble the printer body and look for further paper jams.
choices.B: Remove the printer memory and reseat it in the socket.
choices.D: Restart the print spooler service and inspect the queue.
choices.E: Try reinstalling the print driver for the printer.

discussion.content: Assuming that by "small part" the exam means "one or more pixels", black artifacts on a laptop (LCD) display at a pixel level would indicate dead pixels.

questions.question_text: A user reports that a small part of a laptop's screen displays black instead of the appropriate color. A technician changes the display settings on the user's laptop and then runs onboard diagnostics; however, the issue is still not resolved. Which of the following should the technician perform NEXT?

A manager is trying to display a presentation using a ceiling-mounted projector in a conference room. The projector displays a "no signal" error on the pull-down projector screen. A technician verifies the projector's input cable is securely connected to the manager's laptop, and the laptop is set to presentation mode. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

discussion.content: MOST LIKELY = user error = did not select correct source type

choices.B: The Miracast settings are improperly configured.
choices.D: The source type is set incorrectly on the projector.
choices.A: The laptop does not have the proper display driver installed.
choices.C: The projector is not compatible with the manager's laptop.

discussion.content: Just because he determines, I still think you should check review log.

comments.content: in that case why are you deleting their files but not implement a warning notification?

Because setting up alerts is not going to fix the issue of getting the app to run. think about it in the lens of the troubleshooting theory. The user identified that the problem was the aplication wont work. The technician theorized that the drive was out of space. Next is to come up with an action plan and implement the solution, which is clearing up some space on the drive. D is the only option that does that

I agree, the least intrusive or essentially the easiest and fastest way to get the application to work again... maybe in the near future upgrade to increase storage space or save your extra files in the cloud...

The pattern you noticed is definitely there, however, implementing alerts is a prevention method so it comes last in the troubleshooting methodology. Since the technician has identified the problem, the next step is to implement solutions. The only relevant thing to do is free up disk space.
Whenever you see what should the technician do 1st it's always the least intrusive option. See if you guys notice the pattern!
Because that will not solve the current issue

questions.question_text: An application is not responding on a user's workstation. After doing some research, a technician determines the drive is out of space. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

choices.A: Implement storage alerts to be notified if it happens again.
choices.B: Run diagnostics and review the system logs.
choices.D: Identify files that can be deleted or removed.
choices.C: Ask the user what happened before the application stopped responding.
